data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scopeName' of undefined
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 0.189.0
**System**: linux 3.13.0-48-generic
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scopeName' of undefined

```
At /opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor.js:2263

TypeError: Cannot read property 'scopeName' of undefined
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.usesSoftTabs (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor.js:2263:28)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.handleTokenization (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor.js:2803:44)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor.js:205:24
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:82:11)
    at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.markTokenizationComplete (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/tokenized-buffer.js:306:22)
    at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.tokenizeNextChunk (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/tokenized-buffer.js:299:21)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app/src/tokenized-buffer.js:247:26
    at /opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/underscore-plus/node_modules/underscore/underscore.js:666:47
```


data.title: editor:cut-to-end-of-line slooow
data.body:
Killing to end of line takes >1 second and makes it difficult to use Atom when pressed multiple times on clean installation w/o any additional packages installed. Surprisingly, _mark & cut line_ it is super fast...

```
dvorka@raider:~$ atom --version
0.187.0

dvorka@raider:~$ uname -a
Linux raider 3.13.0-46-generic #77-Ubuntu SMP Mon Mar 2 18:23:39 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

dvorka@raider:~$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS
Release:    14.04
Codename:   trusty

Intel Core i7/16GB RAM/SSD/NVIDIA Quadro K200M
```

data.title: Please help. Thai language problem when i updated atom 0.189.0 in my ubuntu
data.body:
Hello, 
    When I updated atom to version 0.189.0 in my ubuntu desktop. It has problem with thai language.

Now i down grade to 0.188.0. It work. Please fix it in next version. atom is good IDE for me.

Thank you.

data.title: Clipboard does not copy ascii text from atom to firefox
data.body: When attempting to copy text from atom to a different program such as a google search in firefox, the copy attempt fails and does not post any text at all.

data.title: Lint for more styleguide errors
data.body:
This PR adds more coffeelint rules to cover code style requirements from CONTRIBUTING.md, and one rule that wasn't explicitly defined in CONTRIBUTING.md, but was already used everywhere in the codebase.

Refs atom/settings-view#449, atom/settings-view#44, #5982 

/cc @kevinsawicki I wanted to update the coffeelint rules first in core before I go and add coffeelint.json to all the package repos.

data.title: Single quote in html comment section should be ignored
data.body:
I just generated a sample project using using the Ionic Framework and has an html file which has a line of text enclosed as a comment. You can see from the screenshot that it colors the code incorrectly as it thinks the single quote, uses as an apostrophe, is not handled properly.

I am running version 0.188.0 of the Atom editor.

![screen shot 2015-04-02 at 3 56 02 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/277419/6975414/d76b8838-d950-11e4-9b48-abde840bc36a.png)

data.title: Failed to load config.cson / [stdin]:4:13: error: literal is not a function 'themes': [
data.body:
1. Downloaded and installed latest Atom for OS X (very first time)
2. First time opening Atom was by running `atom` from CLI
3. Error thrown

![welcome_guide_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/352182/6957501/fa79bd10-d8b8-11e4-98b1-fdd6d1640fa9.jpg)

**Atom Version**: 0.189.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2

Just installed Atom (v0.189.0) for the first time on this particular system (OS X 10.10.2), and with the very first launch I was greeted with the following error:

> Failed to load `config.cson`
> 
> ```
> [stdin]:4:13: error: literal is not a function
>   'themes': [
>             ^
> ```

`~/.atom/config.cson`: _(after first launch)_

``` coffee
'editor':
  'fontSize': 16
'core':
  'themes': [
    'one-dark-ui'
    'one-dark-syntax'
  ]
   showOnStartup: false
```

`~/.atom/config.cson`: _(after delete + relaunch -- no more error)_

``` coffee
"*":
  "exception-reporting":
    userId: "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  welcome:
    showOnStartup: false
```

`~/.atom/config.cson`: _(after changing theme)_

``` coffee
"*":
  "exception-reporting":
    userId: "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  welcome:
    showOnStartup: false
  core:
    themes: [
      "one-dark-ui"
      "monokai"
    ]
  editor:
    invisibles: {}
```

data.title: :memo: Make TextEditor::getBuffer public
data.body: Fixes #6224

data.title: Make TextEditor::getBuffer public?
data.body:
See: https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-get-cursor-position-as-buffer-offset-one-dimensional-in-chars/15892

Shall we make the [`TextEditor::getBuffer` method](https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-get-cursor-position-as-buffer-offset-one-dimensional-in-chars/15892) a public API?

/cc @abe33 @kevinsawicki

data.title: Cursor doesn't move on undo
data.body:
- Open `package.json` in atom/atom
- Type an `a` on the first line
- Move the cursor to the end of the file
- Undo
- Cursor position isn't restored to location where typed `a` was just undone

data.title: Setup CI on Travis and AppVeyor
data.body:
As discussed on Slack, it would be great to make CI available for everyone :heart:

Ideally we should be able to provision a cibuild on both Travis and AppVeyor, so that we can check if specs pass on Windows and *nix environments.

data.title: Cannot paste into Atom from other apps; cannot paste from Atom into other apps; may crash Atom
data.body: I'm using Atom ver. 0.189.0 on Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS. When I copy a piece of text in atom and I try to paste it the right-click menu either won't show up or will show up without giving me option to paste. The paste shortcut doesn't work either and it creates issues even if I try to copy and paste text from other programs (after I have coping something from atom). I have disable all the extra plugins, so it isn't a plugin issue. I didn't had this issue with the previous version (I am using webupd8 ppa). If I do a right click on a place where there isn't a text entry (meaning a place where it doesn't support paste anyway) the right click menu appears fine.

data.title: Always mutate selections in order
data.body:
Closes #6190 

When copying, cutting, pasting and mutating selections in general, we were accessing selections as they were added to the editor. This caused unexpected behaviors, especially when dealing with multi-line selections.

With this pull-request we now compute all the aforementioned operations ordering the selections first. This is also consistent with how Sublime Text works :sparkles:

/cc: @nathansobo

data.title: Seems that atom don't follow my mouse move
data.body:
I run on ArchLinux with the package atom-editor-bin (precompiled version of atom-editor)
Everything seem to work fine and I updated from 0.188.0 to 0.189.0 today and now I can't select text with mouse (the text cursor just stay at the beginning of my grab), I can't use the scrollbar with mouse too
Seems that mouse is updated only when there is another event (keyboard, mouse click, mouse wheel) but not when mouse move

``` js
  .someMethod('.test' + ':not(:checked)')

  .someMethod('.test' + ':not(:checked)');
```

data.title: Don't show deprecation cop warnings in Atom
data.body: I don't know about anyone else, but I find the little orange triangle with the Deprecation Cop warnings kind of annoying. Especially if I'm not working on a package it really doesn't add anything, plus some lint packages (Rubocop for example) uses the same icon to indicate warnings in code. I feel like this should be an option to show, but not default.

data.title: ctrl-shift-left and ctrl-shift-right do not work on linux
data.body:
On a fresh install of Ubuntu 14.04 64-bit I installed the .deb from http://atom.io and ctrl-shift-left and ctrl-shift-right do not select 'words'.

I tried adding the to copy the body lines from the Windows keymap with ctrl-shift-left and ctrl-shift-right.

data.title: Modifying files outside of Atom creates ENOENT errors
data.body:
Some repro steps that I gathered from the existing issues:
1. Have a file open in branch `something` that doesn't exist in branch `atom`
2. `git checkout atom`
3. ENOENT :boom: 
OR
1. Have a file open in Atom that will be affected by `git rebase`
2. `git rebase`
3. ENOENT :-1:
OR
Just simply rename a file outside of Atom that's currently open inside of Atom.

data.title: Add styleguide for specs
data.body:
A wee PR here to add a section on spec writing. Coming from a suggestion from @nathansobo [here](https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/pull/220#issuecomment-84234793).

Nathan, I tweaked the orginal dog scenario to be a happier one :dog: :grinning: 

[r E n D e R e D](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/0f43b246b4ef5c1759c81440e8b0b2abbf9230d3/CONTRIBUTING.md)

data.title: Deleting a file in Atom will throw an exception when you actually empty the garbage
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Right click in the sidebar and delete any file that's in the project. Possibly requires the file to be open.
2. Empty the Trash
3. Observe the error message
4. If the file had been open see it still open but with garbage characters

**Atom Version**: 0.188.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2
